title: MrMojoRising26
author: MrMojoRising26
content: Hello everyone! I have been experimenting with laser engraved coins lately messing around with some designs for fun here are two of them. Up for auction are two lots I only made 10 of each coin so I figured I would auction a few here. Each lot is 1 coin only. The coins are laser engraved brass 40mm coins each funded with 0.001 BTC The coins addys are engraved on the reverse. I will do different metal types and designs in the near future, but brass helps the shadows pop more on the designs. On a side note I am not sure if grading these is a good idea since the laser really burns into the coins it is not like the coin minting process, but to each their own]LOT 1LOT 2STARTING BID PER LOT: 0.001 BTCMINIMUM BID INCREMENT PER LOT: 0.0002 BTCEND TIME: AUGUST 14th, 2023, 13:00:00 PDT**PAYMENT DUE 24 HOURS AFTER AUCTION ENDS**PAYMENT ADDRESS: 3Q6xqVmawb3B176vvzkZUdUgxDyst9Z1yZSNIPE: Any bid made in last 5 minutes PER LOT will extend the auction 5 minutes beyond the ending time PER LOT.If within those 5 extended minutes, a new bid is made, 5 minutes will be added to the auction from the time of that bid PER LOT.SHIPPING: $10 USD IF YOUR IN THE USA! IF OUTSIDE THE USA I WILL SHIP TO MINERJONES AND HE CAN RESHIP TO YOUR COUNTRY FEES WILL VARY DEPENDING ON LOCATION

comments.author: rsincognito
comments.body: Lot 1: 0.0015BTCLot 2: 0.0015BTCThese are really cool !¬† Great work

comments.author: aoluain
comments.body: These are very cool - are the designs original? who created the artwork?will both lots have the same serial number?

comments.author: Suzuki Matt
comments.body: Beautiful coins. I love the designs. üòç Another banger by Mybits. LFG!

comments.author: CARIBBEAN_TREASURES
comments.created_time: August 12, 2023, 09:07:48 PMLast edit: August 12, 2023, 10:13:39 PM by CARIBBEAN_TREASURES
comments.body: Love me a portrait piece  Are they suppose to be a specific person/ character¬† or represent a viking and a wizard in general?

comments.author: minerjones
comments.body: Quote from: CARIBBEAN_TREASURES on August 12, 2023, 09:07:48 PMLove me a portrait piece  Are they suppose to be a specific person/ character¬† or represent a viking and a wizard in general? From what I can see, it is Lord of the Rings themed with Gimli and 2 dwarves on the first coin and then Gandalf on the 2nd coinSuch good detail in the coins... well done!!Lot 1 .006 BTCLot 2 .006 BTC

comments.author: av8rjeff
comments.body: Wow!¬† Super cool pieces.¬† I shall be bidding.What are you planning to do with the other 9 coins?¬† Curious minds and all.

comments.author: Kryptowerk
comments.body: Okay now! These look amazing, great work! Is this technique also possible with precious metals? Could imagine it vaporizes too much of the material in the process or some other factors not making clean cuts possible.Also interested on what's gonna happen with the other coins.Gosh, the detail and "strength" of these coins is just something new!

comments.author: MrMojoRising26
comments.body: Quote from: aoluain on August 12, 2023, 07:56:35 PMThese are very cool - are the designs original? who created the artwork?will both lots have the same serial number?Thank you the serials are #3 and #10 not matching I never thought of them as a set. The designs are original a friend of mine did the art. As far as the characters go one is Gandalf the other is just viking warriors, but after MJ mentioned Gimli I can see the resemblance. Out of the 10 coins each most are already reserved by friends weeks ago before I even posted on here. If any are left I will auction them at a later date. I have more stuff in the works so I will try to make more coins available next time.

comments.author: MrMojoRising26
comments.body: Quote from: Kryptowerk on August 13, 2023, 12:59:16 AMOkay now! These look amazing, great work! Is this technique also possible with precious metals? Could imagine it vaporizes too much of the material in the process or some other factors not making clean cuts possible.Also interested on what's gonna happen with the other coins.Gosh, the detail and "strength" of these coins is just something new!I did one on a pure silver coin it started out 31.1 grams after the laser it was 28 grams  So silver is not a good idea haha I am gonna try titanium and some other metals next

comments.author: tldr-hodl
comments.body: I seriously don't see that as such insurmountable problem - please, please make a silver Mybits series like that!Just be honest and explicitly put a final weight in the description...(Although a proper flex would be figuring out how much is lost and casting your own coin that would be appropriately heavier to end up with 1 ozt )Anyway I've never seen so alluring coin design, those are truly fantastic!!Seems like something between Eleutheria coins and Saburov's hobo-nickles.https://www.saburovart.com/watches?lightbox=dataItem-jfbj5pj5Quote from: MrMojoRising26 on August 13, 2023, 01:18:02 AMI did one on a pure silver coin it started out 31.1 grams after the laser it was 28 grams  So silver is not a good idea haha I am gonna try titanium and some other metals next

comments.author: krogothmanhattan
comments.body: These look amazing! The have the artistic design and complexity of the Eleutheria coins made in the past!¬† Love em....This opens up so many possibilities in coin making and artistic design possibilities and its exciting on what can be made.¬† Def would love to see what a silver one would look like as well!¬† Congratulations bro!

comments.author: Lesbian Cow
comments.body: Great job with the coins, I look forward to seeing what you make going forward.

I really couldnt care less what is burnt out to get the right image on the coin. Do you have any pics of this coin?¬† ¬† ¬† ¬†I would not mind if it comes less than 31.1 grams or 1 oz or whatever it started with!

comments.author: Kryptowerk
comments.body: Quote from: MrMojoRising26 on August 13, 2023, 01:18:02 AMQuote from: Kryptowerk on August 13, 2023, 12:59:16 AMOkay now! These look amazing, great work! Is this technique also possible with precious metals? Could imagine it vaporizes too much of the material in the process or some other factors not making clean cuts possible.Also interested on what's gonna happen with the other coins.Gosh, the detail and "strength" of these coins is just something new!I did one on a pure silver coin it started out 31.1 grams after the laser it was 28 grams  So silver is not a good idea haha I am gonna try titanium and some other metals nextHaha, I thought something like that would happen. But I mean a 10% loss shouldn't be too bad (not sure about breathing the air, though). Still would love to see some silver.Oh, just after finishing typing I see Krogoth just pretty much wrote down what I am thinking. : )Anyway, great work and please continue.
